subject: Management
title: Premature Consensus
description: A short lesson to help you apply Premature Consensus.

hook.text: The first person to suggest an idea got immediate agreement. Nobody explored alternatives.

buildup.text: Teams sometimes lock in too fast, especially under time pressure or when a senior voice speaks.

discovery.text: Premature consensus skips the divergent thinking phase where better options get surfaced.

twist.text: Agreement feels like progress. But agreement without exploration is just speed without direction.

climax.text: Before converging: generate at least three options. Force the team to think wider before locking in.

punchline.text: Explore before you commit. Fast agreement isn't always smart agreement.

quiz.question: Why is premature consensus dangerous for teams?
options: It skips divergent thinking and misses potentially better options
Teams that agree quickly always make the best decisions
Premature consensus only affects teams without a clear leader
